definition: to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: And the NMD program is, in essence, an U.S. program of unilateral nuclear expansion, which harbors the inherent danger of triggering an arms race at a higher level.
sentences.chinese: 美国此举显然孕育着引发更高水平上军备竞赛的危险。

sentences.english: Wallach, the Yale scholar, suggesting that wars would occur more readily and that a technological arms race would develop.
sentences.chinese: 他提出高科技的军备竞赛可能让战争更容易爆发。

sentences.english: India is also hopelessly outflanked in the arms race.
sentences.chinese: 此外，印度还无可救药的陷入了军备竞赛。

sentences.english: The real story is that the US is fomenting arms races in the Mideast and elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 真实的故事是美国在中东和其他地方煽起了军备竞赛。

sentences.english: But in software these are just nuclear weapons in an arms race.
sentences.chinese: 但是在软件行业，专利只是一个军备竞赛中的核武器。

sentences.english: It is you who want to compete.Da, da, da.
sentences.chinese: 是你们想要军备竞赛的。

sentences.english: The arms race is rooted in the hegemonist policy of the superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 军备竞赛的根源在于超级大国的霸权主义政策。

sentences.english: Russia says that could start a new arms race.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯表示，这可能启动新的军备竞赛。

sentences.english: Of course, it's an endless arms race.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这是一场永无止境的军备竞赛。

sentences.english: Recognize that a space-arms competition could have unwanted consequences.
sentences.chinese: 意识到太空武器军备竞赛会带来都不愿意看到的后果。

sentences.english: He launched the cold war arms race in 1948.
sentences.chinese: 1948年他挑起了冷战军备竞赛的事端。

sentences.english: The world is threatened, too, by a looming new arms race.
sentences.chinese: 若隐若现的新的军备竞赛对全世界产生了太大的威胁。

sentences.english: Nuclear buildup was unlike any other arms race in history.
sentences.chinese: 核力量的增长不象历史上任何军备竞赛。

sentences.english: Indian N-sub will trigger arms race.
sentences.chinese: 印度核潜艇下水将引发军备竞赛。

definition: to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
